abstract.text: Define the custom actions your app exposes to the system, and incorporate
support for existing SiriKit intents.

inlineContent.text: Use app intents to express your app’s capabilities to the system. An app intent
includes the code you need to perform an action, and expresses the data you
require from the system. The system exposes your actions directly from the
Shortcuts app and in system experiences like Siri.
To define an action, create a type that adopts the
or a related protocol that provides the specific behavior you need. Annotate
property wrapper to let the system
know you need the associated information to perform the action.
For more information about features App Intents enables, see

abstract.text: An object that manages the registration and initialization of an app intent’s
dependencies.
An intent that looks for videos based on a search term, then plays the content.
An app intent that marks an action as deprecated and informs people which action to use instead.
An intent that contains a value which can be set.
A type that describes app intent definitions that aren’t part of an app
bundle and their dependencies.
An app intent that takes a person to search results for a specified search term.
The result of performing an action that delivers an app intent back to the initiator of the action.
The result of performing an action that delivers a value back to the initiator.
Make your app’s content and actions discoverable with system experiences like Spotlight, widgets, and enhanced action capabilities of Siri, powered by Apple Intelligence.
Information that the system makes available to an app intent while it performs its action.
Designates intent types provided by App Intents.
An App Intent that plays, pauses, or otherwise modifies audio playback state when it executes.
An app intent that starts, stops or otherwise modifies audio recording state.
Make your app’s actions and content available to Siri and Apple Intelligence with assistant schemas.
An intent that begins or ends an audio transmission with the Push to Talk framework.
Designates intent that will launch an activity that uses device’s camera to capture photos or videos.
Marking your intent with this protocol makes it available as a possible action for Camera quick action.
An interface for configuring a WidgetKit widget.
The human-readable description and metadata for an app intent.

app-intents-PageImage-card.png.alt: [A hero image of an App Intents framework icon.]

abstract.text: An object that represents the output of a completed intent.
Open the associated item.
An intent that starts, pauses, or otherwise modifies a Live Activity.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Making actions and content discoverable and widely available

abstract.text: Adopt App Intents to make your app discoverable with Siri and Apple Intelligence, Spotlight, controls, widgets, and the Action button.
Donate your app’s intents to the system to help it identify trends and predict
future behaviors.
Delete the associated entity(s).
An interface for configuring a Control Center module.
Projections for an app intent that returns non-optional values for parameters.
The result of performing an action that delivers a view back to the initiator of the action.
A property wrapper that resolves a registered dependency at runtime.
The text you want the system to display, or speak, when requesting a value, asking for
disambiguation, or confirming an action.
An interface for providing an app-specific capability that people invoke
from system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
An intent that starts, pauses, or otherwise modifies a Live Activity when it runs.
The result of performing an action that delivers a dialog back to the initiator of the action.
Integrate your app’s intents and entities with the Shortcuts app, Siri, Spotlight, and the Action button on supported iPhone and Apple Watch models.
An intent that reports progress to the system during its execution
An App Intent that plays, pauses, or otherwise modifies audio playback state when it executes.
A protocol you use for app intents which begin their work with the app in the background but
may request to continue in the foreground.
An interface for replacing a custom SiriKit intent that allows existing
shortcuts and donations to continue working.
An app intent with a URL representation.
An interface for managing an extension’s configuration.
An app intent that opens a universal link.
Create app intents, entities, and enumerations that conform to assistant schemas to tap into the enhanced action capabilities of Siri and Apple Intelligence.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Integrating actions with Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: A protocol representing a collection of returned items with support for sectioning.
A type that contains the result of performing an action, and includes optional information to deliver back to the initiator.
